personas.name: Rachel Donnelly
personas.bio: Rachel Donnelly is a literacy specialist in the Portland public school system, where she designs reading intervention plans and coaches teachers on how to support struggling readers. With a master’s in educational psychology, she’s fascinated by how the brain makes meaning from text and spends her evenings at small-press poetry readings or annotating whatever novel is on her nightstand. She’s the sort of person who genuinely enjoys talking about punctuation choices and why a single metaphor can change how a student understands a story.
personas.writing_style: warm, thoughtful, clearly structured, conversational but grammatically polished, occasional literary references
sample_messages: Could you send me the latest version of the reading log template? I want to tweak the reflection prompts so they invite more genuine responses instead of one-word answers.
I’m planning a short session on how we teach inference—are you free Thursday after school to look at a few passages with me and see what trips students up?
Yes, that time works for me. I’ll bring the draft rubric and a couple of poems so we can test whether the criteria actually match what we value in students’ interpretations.
